scheme_name: Ayushman Bharat Pradhan Mantri Jan Arogya Yojana (PM-JAY)
description: A flagship scheme of the Government of India to provide health coverage of Rs. 5 lakhs per family per year for secondary and tertiary care hospitalization to over 12 crore poor and vulnerable families.
eligibility_criteria: Families identified as poor and vulnerable based on the Socio-Economic Caste Census (SECC) 2011 for rural and urban areas. All families previously covered by Rashtriya Swasthya Bima Yojana (RSBY) are also included.
documents_required: Aadhaar Card, Ration Card, PM-JAY e-card (if available), and a government-certified ID.
application_steps: No specific application is needed for eligible beneficiaries as they are identified from the SECC database. Beneficiaries can get their PM-JAY e-card from a Common Service Center (CSC) or an empaneled hospital.

description: A national programme to address the health needs of urban and rural populations, focusing on improving reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health (RMNCH+A) services.
eligibility_criteria: All citizens are eligible to receive services under the mission through public health facilities. Specific benefits may target pregnant women, children, and other vulnerable groups.
documents_required: Generally, none for basic services at public health centers. Aadhaar card may be required for specific programs.
application_steps: Services can be availed by visiting government hospitals, Community Health Centers (CHCs), and Primary Health Centers (PHCs).

description: An income support scheme where all small and marginal farmer families get up to ₹6,000 per year in three installments.
eligibility_criteria: All landholding farmer families in the country are eligible, subject to certain exclusion criteria related to higher income status.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, Citizenship certificate, Landholding papers, Bank account details.
application_steps: Farmers can register through the official PM-KISAN portal (pmkisan.gov.in), through Common Service Centers (CSCs), or via the state-designated nodal officers.

description: A crop insurance scheme that provides comprehensive insurance coverage against crop failure, helping to stabilize the income of farmers.
eligibility_criteria: All farmers including sharecroppers and tenant farmers growing notified crops in the notified areas are eligible for coverage.
documents_required: Land records, Aadhaar card, Bank account details, and crop sowing certificate.
application_steps: Farmers can enroll through the nearest bank, Primary Agricultural Credit Society (PACS), Common Service Centers (CSCs), or the national crop insurance portal.

description: A scheme to provide loans up to ₹10 lakh to non-corporate, non-farm small/micro enterprises.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian Citizen who has a business plan for a non-farm sector income generating activity and whose credit need is less than ₹10 lakh.
documents_required: Proof of identity, Proof of address, Business plan, Application form.
application_steps: 1. Approach a nearby branch of a bank or financial institution. 2. Submit the business plan and application form. 3. Complete the loan formalities.

description: Facilitates bank loans between ₹10 lakh and ₹1 Crore to at least one Scheduled Caste (SC) or Scheduled Tribe (ST) borrower and at least one woman borrower per bank branch for setting up a greenfield enterprise.
eligibility_criteria: SC/ST and/or woman entrepreneurs, above 18 years of age. The enterprise must be in manufacturing, services, or the trading sector. In case of non-individual enterprises, 51% of the shareholding and controlling stake should be held by either an SC/ST or woman entrepreneur.
documents_required: Identity proof, Address proof, Business address proof, Caste certificate (if applicable), Bank account statements.
application_steps: The scheme can be accessed through the Stand-Up India portal, at any bank branch, or through the Lead District Manager.

description: A comprehensive initiative to address the declining Child Sex Ratio (CSR) and related issues of women empowerment. It also includes financial components like the Sukanya Samriddhi Yojana.
eligibility_criteria: Aimed at the girl child. The Sukanya Samriddhi Account can be opened for any girl child below the age of 10.
documents_required: Birth certificate of the girl child, Identity proof of the parent/guardian, Address proof of the parent/guardian.
application_steps: The financial part involves opening a Sukanya Samriddhi Account (SSA) in a post office or a designated bank branch.

description: A maternity benefit program that provides a cash incentive of ₹5,000 to pregnant women and lactating mothers for the first living child of the family.
eligibility_criteria: All pregnant women and lactating mothers, excluding those who are in regular employment with the Central Government or State Government or any Public Sector Undertaking.
documents_required: Duly filled application form, MCP card (Mother and Child Protection card), Aadhaar card, Bank/Post office account details.
application_steps: Eligible women can register at their nearest Anganwadi Centre (AWC) or an approved health facility.

description: An initiative by the Government of India to provide affordable housing to the urban poor.
eligibility_criteria: The beneficiary family should not own a pucca house in any part of India. The scheme is divided into categories based on annual income.
documents_required: Aadhaar Card, Proof of income, Affidavit stating the family does not own a pucca house.
application_steps: Eligible beneficiaries can apply online through the official PMAY-U website or offline through Common Service Centers (CSCs).

description: A rural housing scheme aimed at providing a pucca house with basic amenities to all houseless households and those living in kutcha and dilapidated houses in rural areas.
eligibility_criteria: Houseless families and families living in kutcha houses in rural areas, based on data from the Socio-Economic and Caste Census (SECC) 2011.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, Bank account details, MGNREGA-registered Job Card, Swachh Bharat Mission (SBM) number.
application_steps: Beneficiaries are identified by the Gram Sabha from the SECC data. The list is then verified and finalized by the competent authority.

description: A one-stop solution through which various services starting from student application, receipt, processing, sanction and disbursal of various scholarships to Students are enabled.
eligibility_criteria: Varies widely depending on the specific scholarship. Generally based on academic merit, category (SC/ST/OBC), and family income.
documents_required: Educational documents, Domicile Certificate, Income Certificate, Bank passbook, Caste certificate (if applicable).
application_steps: 1. Register on the National Scholarship Portal (scholarships.gov.in). 2. Fill the application form. 3. Upload the required documents. 4. Submit the application.

description: An integrated scheme for school education extending from pre-school to class 12 to ensure inclusive and equitable quality education at all levels.
eligibility_criteria: The scheme applies to all children from pre-school to class 12 in government and aided schools across the country.
documents_required: Not applicable for students to apply directly. It's an administrative scheme for schools and states.
application_steps: This is a centrally sponsored scheme implemented by state governments. Benefits like free textbooks and uniforms are provided directly through schools.

description: A government-backed pension scheme in India, primarily targeted at the unorganized sector. It provides a defined pension after the age of 60.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian citizen between 18-40 years of age with a savings bank account. They should not be a member of any statutory social security scheme.
documents_required: Aadhaar Card, Mobile Number, Bank Account details.
application_steps: Approach the bank/post office branch where the individual's savings bank account is held. Fill up the APY registration form and submit it.

description: A scheme of the Ministry of Petroleum & Natural Gas for providing LPG connections to women from Below Poverty Line (BPL) households.
eligibility_criteria: An adult woman belonging to a BPL household, who does not have an LPG connection in her household. The beneficiary must be listed in the SECC-2011 data.
documents_required: KYC form, Aadhaar card, Bank account details, Ration card.
application_steps: A woman from a BPL household can apply for a new LPG connection by submitting the prescribed application form to the nearest LPG distributor.

scheme_name: Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act (MGNREGA)
description: An Indian labour law and social security measure that aims to guarantee the 'right to work', providing at least 100 days of wage employment per year.
eligibility_criteria: Must be a citizen of India and above the age of 18 years. The applicant must be part of a local household and must volunteer to do unskilled manual work.
documents_required: Ration card, Aadhaar Card, Bank account details, Photograph.
application_steps: Application for a Job Card can be made on a plain paper to the local Gram Panchayat. The household is then registered and a Job Card is issued.

scheme_name: Deendayal Antyodaya Yojana-National Rural Livelihoods Mission (DAY-NRLM)
description: A program to reduce poverty by enabling poor households to access gainful self-employment and skilled wage employment opportunities, resulting in sustainable livelihoods.
eligibility_criteria: Primarily focused on mobilizing rural poor households into Self Help Groups (SHGs). At least one woman member from each identified rural poor household is to be brought under the SHG network.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, BPL card, Bank account details.
application_steps: The mission works through community-based organizations. Individuals join or form Self Help Groups at the village level to access the scheme's benefits.

description: A skill development initiative scheme for recognition and standardization of skills to enable Indian youth to take up industry-relevant skill training.
eligibility_criteria: Any Indian national who is an unemployed youth or, school/college dropouts. The candidate should possess an Aadhaar card and a bank account.
documents_required: Aadhaar Card, two passport size photos, bank account details.
application_steps: Find a PMKVY Training Center, enroll for a course of your choice, attend the skill training, get assessed and certified.

description: A scheme to promote apprenticeship training and to increase the engagement of apprentices by providing financial support to industrial establishments.
eligibility_criteria: Candidates must be at least 14 years old and meet the educational and physical qualifications required for the specific apprenticeship trade.
documents_required: Aadhaar card, Educational qualification certificates, Passport size photos.
application_steps: Candidates can register on the apprenticeship portal. Employers post vacancies, and candidates can apply for them.

description: A scheme that aims to provide financial assistance to startups for proof of concept, prototype development, product trials, market entry, and commercialization.
eligibility_criteria: A startup, recognized by DPIIT, incorporated not more than 2 years ago at the time of application. Must have a business idea to develop a product or service.
documents_required: Company registration documents, Details of the business idea, Pitch deck, Founder's KYC.
application_steps: Apply online through the official Startup India portal. The application is screened by an Incubator which then selects the startup for the seed fund.
